IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To build healthy spirit, mind and body for all in the community through programs, services and facilities that promote good health, wellness, community services, youth and adult development.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE MISSION OF THE YMCA OF THE UPPER MAIN LINE IS TO BUILD HEALTHY SPIRIT, MIND AND BODY FOR ALL. WE IMPROVE QUALITY OF LIFE THROUGH PROGRAMS, SERVICES AND FACILITIES THAT PROMOTE GOOD HEALTH, WELLNESS, COMMUNITY SERVICES, YOUTH AND ADULT DEVELOPMENT. BY FOCUSING ON FOUR CORE VALUES IN ALL OF OUR INITIATIVES - CARING, HONESTY, RESPECT AND RESPONSIBILITY, WE ENCOURAGE PEOPLE TO DO GOOD WORK, AND HELP THEM BECOME RESPONSIBLE CITIZENS. WE SERVE MEN, WOMEN AND CHILDREN OF ALL AGES, RACES, INCOMES AND RELIGIONS. WE PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THOSE WHO NEED IT. BUILDING STRONG CHARACTER IS THE CORNERSTONE WE USE TO BUILD STRONG KIDS, STRONG FAMILIES AND STRONG COMMUNITIES. WE COLLABORATE WITH OTHERS TO IDENTIFY NEEDS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY AND RESPOND TO THEM SO THAT THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY BENEFITS FROM OUR EFFORTS.
IRS990.Description: Youth Development - The YMCA provides a variety of programs aimed at building self-confidence, providing positive role models and helping youth and teens become successful leaders who care about the world around them. We promote inter-personal communication skills and positive values like caring, honesty, respect and responsibility. Youth & Teen programs include Arts & Humanities, Environmental Education, Earth Service Corps, volunteer and employment opportunities, international initiatives and special programs that develop skills and promote independence among persons with disabilities. In 2010, 6,000 people in our community were served. Social Responsibility - Our childcare programs offer high quality childcare activities for infants, preschool and school age children from all segments of our community. We offer state-licensed childcare programs, both full and part-time, as well as summer camp (which serves as childcare for working parents). All provide a safe and nurturing environment where youth can develop self-esteem and good values. Financial assistance is available to those who cannot afford to pay. Our rates are affordable and we work with Chester County Information Services to accept subsidies for low-income families. We also fill financial assistance gaps when families are placed in long waiting periods. Child care is available at 5 different sites in the community. In 2010, 7,500 children in our community were served.

Activity2.Description: Healthy Living - The focus on wellness programming is the promotion and maintenance of good health as well as the prevention of disease in men, women and children. The YMCA has identified the growing national obesity and diabetes rates as a critical social issue that must be addressed. Our health and wellness programs are designed to help people develop new skills and grow in spirit, mind and body by setting realistic goals for self-improvement and disease prevention through an active lifestyle, proper nutrition, stress management and health education. We encourage lifelong good health. We serve people of all ages, abilities, races, nationalities and religions, and provide financial assistance to those who need it. Health enhancement includes programs such as youth, family and adult memberships, group exercise, active older adult programs, aquatics, gymnastics, youth and adult sports. In 2010, 26,000 people in our community were served

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Change in Fair Value of Interest Rate SWAP
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: During the fiscal year ended June 30, 2010, there was a decrease in the fair value of the interest rate SWAP of $147,531.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Part VI, Section B, Line 15a & B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Executive committee reviews compensation for all top management officials.
The organization makes available to the public various documents via guidestar and/or written request.
The organization has members who may elect other members to the governing body by majority vote. All decisions made by the governing body require majority vote.
Form 990 is emailed to the Board of Directors for review prior to the board meeting. Form 990 will be reviewed and approved at the Board meeting before it is filed with the Internal Revenue Service.
The conflict of Interest Policy is distributed to the Members of the Board. Board Members are required to disclose any business or personal conflicts to the organization.
